alert.note: Alert for Northern Lycoming; Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 9:59AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SULLIVAN...NORTHERN LYCOMING...AND TIOGA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 958 AM EDT, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from Wellsboro to just north of Dushore and moving southeast at 15 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Wellsboro, Laporte, Morris, Blossburg, Gaines, Covington, Arnot, Kettle Creek Gorge, Waterville, Leonard Harrison State Park, Ralston, Cedar Run, Cammal, Trout Run, Lincoln Falls, Barbours, Shunk, Little Pine State Park, Leetonia and Ricketts Glen State Park. * This includes the following highways... Route 6 between near Gaines and west of Mansfield, and near east of Mansfield. Route 15 from south of Trout Run to Mansfield. Route 220 from south of Muncy Valley to north of Dushore. State Road 14 from Trout Run to the Bradford County line. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
